newsitem.title: MOROCCO: Morocco to lay first stone for $106 mln free zone.
newsitem.headline: Morocco to lay first stone for $106 mln free zone.

text.p: Morocco will lay the first stone on Tuesday for a one billion dirhams ($106 million) free trade zone near the northern port of Tangier, the industry ministry said on Monday.
"Launching work for the future free export zone in Tangier's Boukhalef area will be the first such zone to be built by a grouping of private investors," said the ministry in a statement.
It named three leading Moroccan financial groups among the investors who will also manage and promote the trading of the zone.
The project is expected to generate between 55,000 and 60,000 jobs, it said.
The zone covers 275 hectares (687.5 acres) to be split into 1,290 lots allocated to would-be industrialists and service providers.

The industry ministry said the free zone, located close by a pipeline supplying European markets with more than eight million tonnes of gas from Algeria through Morocco, gives future investors the security of future energy provision.
